content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can do it using Julia DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map((x) -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input, then for each DateTime in the column `dt`, it extracts the year and month using the `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions respectively. It then multiplies the year by 100 to get the full year-month format (yyyymm) and adds this to a new column `ym`. The function finally returns the modified DataFrame.
